intro: Gutierrezia gymnospermoides, commonly known as the desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia gymnospermoides is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
